body:
%PATH% contains lots of directories, but was not altered to include the Go bin directory, I should have added it to the initial report. I have now been playing with the PATH and am no longer sure what the state was before the changes. This is the PATH now (<...> means is edited):

C:\Program Files (x86)\<...>;C:\Oracle\<...>\system32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem;C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\;C:\Program Files (x86)\<...>\;C:\Program Files (x86)\QuickTime\QTSystem\;C:\Program Files\<...>\bin;C:\Program Files(x86)\Skype\Phone\;C:\Go\bin;;C:\Program Files\Docker Toolbox\;C:\Go\bin

I notice that the C:\Go\bin is listed twice. The last 2 directories are from my personal account PATH, the rest is the system PATH (the double ;; is the delimiter). I added the last dir (C:\Go\bin) manually. I cannot confirm with 100% confidence that the Go bin dir that is now twice in the Path (actually the system PATH ends with the go bin dir) was not there a few days ago, i no longer have the terminal open.

OS info:

OS Name:                   Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise
OS Version:                6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 Build 7601
